questions.question: What does the forEach method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Executes a provided function once for each array element.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Executes a provided function once for each array element.

questions.question: What does the map method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the calling array.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the calling array.

questions.question: What does the filter method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.

questions.question: What does the find method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Returns the first element that satisfies the provided testing function.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Returns the first element that satisfies the provided testing function.

questions.question: What does the reduce method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Executes a provided function once for each array element.
Reduces the array to a single value by executing a provided function.
Creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Reduces the array to a single value by executing a provided function.

questions.question: What does the some method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Checks if at least one element in the array passes the test implemented by the provided function.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Checks if at least one element in the array passes the test implemented by the provided function.

questions.question: What does the every method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Checks if all elements in the array pass the test implemented by the provided function.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Checks if all elements in the array pass the test implemented by the provided function.

questions.question: What does the includes method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Determines whether an array includes a certain value among its entries.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Determines whether an array includes a certain value among its entries.

questions.question: What does the slice method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Returns the selected elements in an array, as a new array object.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Returns the selected elements in an array, as a new array object.

questions.question: What does the splice method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Changes the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements and/or adding new elements in place.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Changes the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements and/or adding new elements in place.

questions.question: What does the flat method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Creates a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the specified depth.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Creates a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the specified depth.

questions.question: What does the concat method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).

questions.question: What does the indexOf method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

questions.question: What does the findIndex method do in JavaScript arrays?
options: Returns the index of the first element in the array that satisfies the provided testing function. Otherwise, it returns -1.
Adds a new item to the end of the array.
Removes the first element from the array.
Sorts the elements of the array in place.
questions.answer: Returns the index of the first element in the array that satisfies the provided testing function. Otherwise, it returns -1.
